attributes.action: Update Britain's Electoral laws to address campaign lies & other 21stC issues.
attributes.additional_details:
New Statesman : " political advertising is exempt from the regulation that would otherwise bar false claims and outrageous promises." lie.https://www.newstatesman.com/politics/uk/2016/06/how-brexit-campaign-lied-us-and-got-away-it
From a Guardian report 
"An LSE report concluded UK’s electoral laws were “weak and helpless” in the face of new forms of digital campaigning.”.
https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2017/may/07/the-great-british-brexit-robbery-hijacked-democracy
attributes.background: This petition requests that Parliament deals with the threats posed by misinformation about the issues to be balloted, and the activities of agencies employed by or donating their services to any campaign group  using covert manipulation of public opinion by enacting appropriate legislation.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what changes you'd like Parliament to make to the law.
